author: Albert Einstein
quote: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.

author: Mark Twain
quote: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.

author: Winston Churchill
quote: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: If you don't like something, change it. If you can't change it, change your attitude.

author: Confucius
quote: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
quote: Believe you can and you're halfway there.

author: Dr. Seuss
quote: Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened.

author: John Lennon
quote: Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans.

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
quote: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
quote: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow is our doubts of today.

author: Mother Teresa
quote: Spread love everywhere you go. Let no one ever come to you without leaving happier.

author: Steve Jobs
quote: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life.

author: Nelson Mandela
quote: It always seems impossible until it's done.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.

author: Buddha
quote: The mind is everything. What you think you become.

author: Abraham Lincoln
quote: Whatever you are, be a good one.

author: Leonardo da Vinci
quote: Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.

author: Aristotle
quote: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.

author: Vincent Van Gogh
quote: What would life be if we had no courage to attempt anything?

author: Socrates
quote: An unexamined life is not worth living.

author: Benjamin Franklin
quote: Tell me and I forget, teach me and I may remember, involve me and I learn.

author: Plato
quote: Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something.

author: Dalai Lama
quote: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.

author: Walt Disney
quote: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.

author: Henry Ford
quote: Whether you think you can, or you think you can't – you're right.

author: J.K. Rowling
quote: It is our choices that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.

author: Oprah Winfrey
quote: Turn your wounds into wisdom.

author: Bruce Lee
quote: If you love life, don't waste time, for time is what life is made up of.

author: Helen Keller
quote: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see a shadow.

author: George Bernard Shaw
quote: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.

author: Gandhi
quote: Be the change that you wish to see in the world.

author: Anne Frank
quote: How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
quote: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: We know what we are, but know not what we may be.

author: Pablo Picasso
quote: Everything you can imagine is real.

author: Stephen Hawking
quote: Intelligence is the ability to adapt to change.

author: Charles Dickens
quote: No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another.

author: Carl Jung
quote: I am not what happened to me, I am what I choose to become.

author: Isaac Newton
quote: If I have seen further it is by standing on the shoulders of Giants.

author: Marie Curie
quote: Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood.

author: Jane Austen
quote: There is no charm equal to tenderness of heart.

author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
quote: The soul is healed by being with children.

author: Hermann Hesse
quote: Some of us think holding on makes us strong, but sometimes it is letting go.

author: Edgar Allan Poe
quote: I have great faith in fools—self-confidence my friends will call it.

author: Virginia Woolf
quote: No need to be anybody but oneself.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: Courage is grace under pressure.

author: Nikola Tesla
quote: The present is theirs; the future, for which I really worked, is mine.

author: Mark Twain
quote: Kindness is the language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see.

author: Rumi
quote: Do not be satisfied with the stories that come before you. Unfold your own myth.

author: Sun Tzu
quote: In the midst of chaos, there is also opportunity.

author: C.S. Lewis
quote: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.

author: Malcolm X
quote: Education is the passport to the future, for tomorrow belongs to those who prepare for it today.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quote: Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Willing is not enough; we must do.

author: T.S. Eliot
quote: Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.

author: Haruki Murakami
quote: Pain is inevitable. Suffering is optional.

author: Sylvia Plath
quote: The worst enemy to creativity is self-doubt.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
quote: Not all those who wander are lost.

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls.

author: George Orwell
quote: Freedom is the right to tell people what they do not want to hear.

author: James Baldwin
quote: Not everything that is faced can be changed, but nothing can be changed until it is faced.

author: Simone de Beauvoir
quote: Change your life today. Don’t gamble on the future, act now, without delay.

author: Toni Morrison
quote: If you want to fly, you have to give up the things that weigh you down.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quote: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.

author: Brene Brown
quote: Vulnerability is the birthplace of innovation, creativity, and change.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.

author: H.P. Lovecraft
quote: The oldest and strongest emotion of mankind is fear, and the oldest and strongest kind of fear is fear of the unknown.

author: Alan Watts
quote: You are the universe experiencing itself.

author: Ray Bradbury
quote: Jump, and you will find out how to unfold your wings as you fall.

author: David Foster Wallace
quote: Everybody worships. The only choice we get is what to worship.

author: Carl Sagan
quote: Somewhere, something incredible is waiting to be known.

author: George Eliot
quote: It is never too late to be what you might have been.

author: Franz Kafka
quote: A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us.

author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
quote: What matters in life is not what happens to you but what you remember and how you remember it.

author: Emily Dickinson
quote: Hope is the thing with feathers that perches in the soul.

author: Margaret Atwood
quote: A word after a word after a word is power.

author: James Clear
quote: You do not rise to the level of your goals. You fall to the level of your systems.

author: Rainer Maria Rilke
quote: Let everything happen to you: beauty and terror. Just keep going. No feeling is final.

author: Kurt Vonnegut
quote: We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be.

author: Jean-Paul Sartre
quote: Man is condemned to be free.

author: Zora Neale Hurston
quote: There are years that ask questions and years that answer.

author: Elie Wiesel
quote: The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference.

author: Seneca
quote: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.

author: Joseph Campbell
quote: The privilege of a lifetime is being who you are.

author: Harper Lee
quote: People generally see what they look for, and hear what they listen for.

author: Dale Carnegie
quote: Develop success from failures. Discouragement and failure are two of the surest stepping stones to success.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.

author: John Steinbeck
quote: And now that you don’t have to be perfect, you can be good.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams. Live the life you have imagined.

author: Eckhart Tolle
quote: Realize deeply that the present moment is all you have.

author: Robert Frost
quote: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.

author: Jules Verne
quote: Anything one man can imagine, other men can make real.

author: Stephen King
quote: The scariest moment is always just before you start.

author: Anne Lamott
quote: Almost everything will work again if you unplug it for a few minutes, including you.

author: Roxane Gay
quote: Change requires intent and effort. It really is that simple.

author: Brené Brown
quote: You can choose courage or you can choose comfort. You cannot have both.

author: Octavia Butler
quote: You don't start out writing good stuff. You start out writing crap and thinking it's good stuff.

author: Isabel Allende
quote: We all have an unsuspected reserve of strength inside that emerges when life puts us to the test.

author: Maggie Stiefvater
quote: You are made of the sea and the stars, and one day you are going to find yourself again.

author: Neil Gaiman
quote: The world always seems brighter when you've just made something that wasn't there before.

author: Patrick Rothfuss
quote: Words are pale shadows of forgotten names.

author: Brandon Sanderson
quote: Journey before destination.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: I can be changed by what happens to me. But I refuse to be reduced by it.

author: Virginia Woolf
quote: No need to be anybody but oneself.

author: Malala Yousafzai
quote: One child, one teacher, one book, one pen can change the world.

author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
quote: Real change, enduring change, happens one step at a time.

author: Jane Austen
quote: There is no charm equal to tenderness of heart.

author: Audre Lorde
quote: Your silence will not protect you.

author: Harper Lee
quote: The one thing that doesn’t abide by majority rule is a person’s conscience.

author: Margaret Mead
quote: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world.

author: Toni Morrison
quote: If you want to fly, you have to give up the things that weigh you down.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
quote: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.

author: Marie Curie
quote: Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood.

author: Susan B. Anthony
quote: Independence is happiness.

author: Roxane Gay
quote: Change requires intent and effort. It really is that simple.

author: Isabel Allende
quote: We all have an unsuspected reserve of strength inside that emerges when life puts us to the test.

author: J.K. Rowling
quote: It is our choices that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.

author: Oprah Winfrey
quote: Turn your wounds into wisdom.

author: Anne Lamott
quote: Almost everything will work again if you unplug it for a few minutes, including you.

author: Simone de Beauvoir
quote: Change your life today. Don’t gamble on the future, act now, without delay.

author: Malala Yousafzai
quote: Let us make our future now, and let us make our dreams tomorrow’s reality.

author: Frida Kahlo
quote: Feet, what do I need you for when I have wings to fly?

author: Sally Ride
quote: You can’t be what you can’t see.

author: Gloria Steinem
quote: Dreaming, after all, is a form of planning.

author: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie
quote: Your silence serves no one. Speak up.

author: Helen Keller
quote: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement.

author: Florence Nightingale
quote: I attribute my success to this: I never gave or took any excuse.

author: Louisa May Alcott
quote: I am not afraid of storms, for I am learning how to sail my ship.

author: Dolly Parton
quote: If you don’t like the road you’re walking, start paving another one.

author: Serena Williams
quote: Every woman’s success should be an inspiration to another. We’re strongest when we cheer each other on.

author: Ada Lovelace
quote: That brain of mine is something more than merely mortal, as time will show.

author: Angela Davis
quote: I am no longer accepting the things I cannot change. I am changing the things I cannot accept.

author: Brené Brown
quote: You can choose courage or you can choose comfort. You cannot have both.

author: Shonda Rhimes
quote: Dreams are lovely. But they are just dreams. It’s the doing that matters.

author: Mindy Kaling
quote: If you don’t see a clear path for what you want, sometimes you have to make it yourself.

author: Ava DuVernay
quote: If your dream only includes you, it’s too small.

author: Betty White
quote: Kindness and consideration of somebody besides yourself keeps you feeling young.

author: Indira Gandhi
quote: The power to question is the basis of all human progress.

author: Michelle Obama
quote: Success isn’t about how much money you make; it’s about the difference you make in people’s lives.

author: Gwendolyn Brooks
quote: We are each other’s harvest; we are each other’s business; we are each other’s magnitude and bond.

author: Tarana Burke
quote: The work is more important than the recognition.

author: Lucille Ball
quote: I'd rather regret the things I've done than regret the things I haven't done.

author: Gloria Vanderbilt
quote: I've always believed that one woman's success can only help another woman's success.

author: Bell Hooks
quote: The moment we choose love, we begin to move towards freedom.

author: Hildegard of Bingen
quote: Even in a world that’s being shipwrecked, remain brave and strong.

author: Boethius
quote: Nothing is miserable unless you think it so.

author: Plutarch
quote: What we achieve inwardly will change outer reality.

author: Seneca
quote: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.

author: Cicero
quote: If you have a garden and a library, you have everything you need.

author: Saint Augustine
quote: The world is a book, and those who do not travel read only one page.

author: Epictetus
quote: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.

author: Rumi
quote: Do not be satisfied with the stories that come before you. Unfold your own myth.

author: Omar Khayyam
quote: Be happy for this moment. This moment is your life.

author: Avicenna
quote: The knowledge of anything, since all things have causes, is not acquired or complete unless it is known by its causes.

author: Sappho
quote: Although they are only breath, words which I command are immortal.

author: Homer
quote: Hateful to me as the gates of Hades is that man who hides one thing in his heart and speaks another.

author: Aristotle
quote: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.

author: Plato
quote: Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something.

author: Heraclitus
quote: No man ever steps in the same river twice, for it's not the same river and he's not the same man.

author: Thucydides
quote: The secret to happiness is freedom... And the secret to freedom is courage.

author: Xenophon
quote: The sweetest of all sounds is praise.

author: Isidore of Seville
quote: War with vices, peace with individuals.

author: Saint Benedict
quote: He who labors as he prays lifts his heart to God with his hands.

author: Alcuin of York
quote: Those people should not be listened to who keep saying the voice of the people is the voice of God, since the riotousness of the crowd is always close to madness.

author: Julian of Norwich
quote: All shall be well, and all shall be well, and all manner of thing shall be well.

author: Christine de Pizan
quote: Just as women's bodies are softer than men's, so their understanding is sharper.

author: Geoffrey Chaucer
quote: The greatest scholars are not usually the wisest people.

author: Dante Alighieri
quote: The darkest places in hell are reserved for those who maintain their neutrality in times of moral crisis.

author: Peter Abelard
quote: By doubting we are led to question, by questioning we arrive at the truth.

author: Thomas Aquinas
quote: To one who has faith, no explanation is necessary. To one without faith, no explanation is possible.

author: Ibn Khaldun
quote: The past resembles the future more than one drop of water resembles another.

author: Meister Eckhart
quote: If the only prayer you ever say in your entire life is thank you, it will be enough.
